episode_event_champion_kanto/4001_1101_0:
One day, Professor Oak came across some
Trainers who were looking down in the dumps.
episode_event_champion_kanto/4001_1001_0:
Those Trainers are beginners, if I
remember correctly.
Can training like this make me as strong as Red?
Maybe I’m not training my Pokémon correctly...

They seem to be struggling because they set their
goals too high.

For new Trainers, setting goals too high can be
counterproductive.

I wonder if there’s anything I could do to help
Trainers like them who are just starting out...
episode_event_champion_kanto/4002_1001_0: The Neo Champion Stadium will be held soon.
I’d like you three to participate in it.

That’s the tournament to decide Pasio’s Neo
Champion—an example for everyone else to
measure up against...right?

You want us to be the judges or something?
I’m not gonna go easy on them, you know!

Actually, I’d like you all to join as challengers,
not judges!
episode_event_champion_kanto/6801_1001_0: So all three of us became Neo Champions, but...
Me and Zapdos are definitely the coolest!
Whaaat? That’s gotta be me and Moltres!
Should we decide who’s the best again?
episode_event_champion_kanto/4003_1001_0:
I’m not trying to be cocky, but...are you sure
we’re allowed to participate?

You three are already an example for a lot of
sync pairs.

But for this Neo Champion Stadium, participants
will be judged on their “exemplary leadership,”
at Professor Oak’s request.

I’d like you all to find new potential within
yourselves by coaching new Trainers.

After all, Neo Champions aren’t chosen solely for
their strength!
Here are the regulations for this round.

Each participant will be teamed up with two
beginner Trainers.
episode_event_champion_kanto/4003_1001_1:
You’ll guide them in battle as team leaders—and
show us your ability to help them grow!

On top of that, there will be a written exam to
test their Pokémon knowledge!

It’s important to know about the Pokémon you’re
battling alongside!

I’ve entrusted you all with a Pokédex, so I’m sure
your Pokémon knowledge is sound.

It shouldn’t be too hard to pass on that knowledge
to younger Trainers, right?

Well, this gives us a bit of a challenge, then,
doesn’t it.

Yeah! As Lance said, I think it will open up new
possibilities for us!
Oh yeah! I have a suggestion for you two.
episode_event_champion_kanto/4003_1001_2:
What do you think of forming sync pairs with those
three?

I was inspired when I saw everyone from Galar
battling...

And if we form sync pairs with Pokémon we
haven’t before, they can grow alongside the
Trainers we’re coaching!
I don’t mind. What about you, Red?

Let’s compete to see which of the three of us
is best!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4004_1001_0:
You better be ready, ’cause I’m gonna train you
up good!
Um... Are these our training partners?
Nice to meet you. Let’s give it our best today.

You two are lucky you get to train with the most
elite Trainer of all. Me!

Haha... He’s like that, but hopefully you’ll all
get along.
But all three of them are Neo Champions!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4004_1001_1: They’re pretty strong for you two, but don’t worry!

Once you’ve a few pointers from me, you’ll
definitely beat them.
episode_event_champion_kanto/4005_1001_0:
Question for you two! What do you think is
important for a Pokémon Trainer?
Knowledge of Pokémon moves and matchups?

The most important thing for a
Pokémon Trainer is...

I love the warmth you give off, Moltres. You’re the
absolute best!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4005_1001_1:
For starters, you have to get up close to your
Pokémon to understand them!

Now it’s your turn! Let’s get to know your partner
Pokémon even better!

By being friends with your partner, you can learn
things about them that aren’t in the Pokédex.
And sometimes that lets you battle in new ways!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4006_1001_0: Yo, Leaf! Training going all right?
It’s almost scary how smooth mine is going!

Same here! My teammates are quick learners,
so they’re doing great!
By the way, I wonder how Red’s doing...
Yeah. He doesn’t talk much, does he.

He seemed all in, but I’ve never seen him
teach others.
Maybe we should go check on him?
Yeah... I kinda have a bad feeling...
episode_event_champion_kanto/4007_1101_0: When the two arrived, they saw...
episode_event_champion_kanto/4007_1001_0: We give up! We told you, we surrender!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4007_1101_0: Red relentlessly beating the new Trainers...
episode_event_champion_kanto/4008_1001_0: I see Red challenged you to an all-out battle, huh.

I’ll give you a Potion so you can heal your
Pokémon.
Hey, aren’t you being a bit rough, Red?

You haven’t forgotten what we’re being judged
on, have you?
episode_event_champion_kanto/4008_1001_1:
You’re saying that’s the reason you’re doing this?
Are you serious?

Your teammates won’t keep up with you if you
carry on like this.
Well, don’t go overboard with the tough love, Red.

Just make sure your teammates don’t run away
before the judging, OK?
Don’t push them too hard, all right?
episode_event_champion_kanto/4009_1101_0:
One day, with the Neo Champion Stadium fast
approaching...
episode_event_champion_kanto/4009_1001_0: Don’t be so nervous! Have confidence in yourself!

Both of you have already beaten a team of three
Neo Champions!
B-but...we lost way more times than we won...
Just the thought of holding you back is...
I wonder if I’ll be able to battle properly...

If you keep worrying, you won’t be able to show
what you’ve got! C’mon, let’s have fun!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4009_1001_1:
(It’s gonna come down to whether they can show
them during the assessment.)
episode_event_champion_kanto/4010_1001_0: Red, we’re gonna ask to battle them!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4011_1101_0:
On the day of the Neo Champion
Stadium assessment...

The first test—the test of Pokémon knowledge—
had been completed...
episode_event_champion_kanto/4011_1001_0: Impressive! I’m surprised everyone did so well!

I can see Leaf’s team has a deep knowledge of
Pokémon—and love of them.

Yes. To truly understand Pokémon, it’s important to
have love, not just knowledge.

That’s why Leaf’s team scored the highest on the
Pokémon knowledge test!

And who better to share the joy with than our
partner Pokémon!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4011_1001_1: Love and trust in your Pokémon...

I didn’t think we did too bad, but I guess we can’t
beat Leaf, huh.
episode_event_champion_kanto/4012_1101_0:
After that was a practical test—on Pokémon
battling.

The three teams led by Red, Blue, and Leaf
kept winning without difficulty.

Then, Blue’s team and Leaf’s team clashed in the
semifinals!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4012_1001_0: Don’t worry! You all did so well!
You trained your team so well in such short time!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4012_1001_1:
I’d expect no less from the Gym Leader of
Viridian City!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4013_1001_0: I’m not losing to you this time, Red!

Let’s show them the results of our training,
you two!
We’ll be sure to win for you, Blue!
Whoa, they look strong as well!
I can’t wait to see what our battle is like!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4013_1001_1: I’ll get you back with this! Here I come!
No, I’m the one who should apologize.
episode_event_champion_kanto/4014_1001_0:
I didn’t want to accept it, but...there are things
I can improve on.
But it’s true I failed to teach you something.

Because I kept on teaching you to win, I made you
afraid to lose.
episode_event_champion_kanto/4014_1001_1: That’s why Red was going at them at full strength.

So they could battle anyone without being afraid
to lose.

Of course. If a new Trainer lost to Red over and
over again...
They wouldn’t care if they lost to anyone!
All they’d care about is the joy of battling!

“Let’s enjoy battling together” may be a simple
message...but it’s very you, Red.
episode_event_champion_kanto/4015_1001_0:
Now, it’s time to announce the Neo Champions for
this round!

The first is Leaf, who taught how important it is
to not only have knowledge of Pokémon but love
them, too!

And that deep knowledge was on full display
during battle!

But most importantly, to become a first-class
Trainer, you have to love Pokémon.

Blue’s team scored well on both tests—written and
practical.

Seeing that, the other judges all praised your
coaching.
Such leadership is worthy of a Neo Champion title!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4015_1001_1:
It’s hard to train a person to enjoy battling no
matter the outcome!

But you did so impressively! Your teammates’ eyes
were strong, sturdy, and unafraid to lose!

The same eyes you had the day you beat me on
the Indigo Plateau!
Although your methods were a little rough!
Thanks to you all, we learned so much!

We’ll keep on getting stronger, and one day,
we’ll be like you—

You’ll never make it to the top if you’re always
following in someone’s footsteps!
episode_event_champion_kanto/4015_1001_2:
That’s right. I want each of you to find your
own strengths!
Then, one day, you can try to take us down!
